title: Refactored toolkit package so that default features get ignored properly
body:
Bumped package versions and switched out a few deps
Moved toolkit package to main workspace - don't see the use to have a separate package for this
Moved packages to workspace deps so we don't have to copy the versions a billion times

title: v0.7 Upgrade with Storage and Readme Updates (for Cosmwasm v1.0)
body:
Reopening the PR after it was automatically closed when the old branch was deleted. It seems like this needs manual intervention to merge now (probably due to versioning changes) 

The following changes were made to the storage as mentioned in release notes, these changes were approved by @reuvenpo conceptually:

- Added the `Keyset` storage object (A hashset like storage object).
- Allowed further customisation of Keymap and Keyset with new constructor structs called `KeymapBuilder` and `KeysetBuilder` which allow the user to disable the iterator feature (saving gas) or adjust the internal indexes' page size so that the user may determine how many objects are to be stored/loaded together in the iterator.
- `::new_with_page_size(namespace, page_size)` method was added to `AppendStore` and `DequeStore` so that the user may adjust the internal indexes' page size which determine how many objects are to be stored/loaded together in the iterator.
- Minor performance upgrades to `Keymap`, `AppendStore`, and `DequeStore`.

Moreover, I also fixed all the clippy warnings and updated some readme files to reflect cosmwasm 1.0 changes. Cosmwasm v1.0 branch should probably be made default

title: Cosmwasm v1.0 fix revoke permit
body: Fixed bug of revoke_permit() created by setting an empty value for the revoked permit key

title: Dev 0.5 Update (for Cosmwasm v1.0 Branch)
body: This is a cosmwasm v1.0 port of the changes done by @reuvenpo in https://github.com/scrtlabs/secret-toolkit/pull/59 + minor storage readme updates (related to version change from 0.4 -> 0.5)

title: cw-v1 fix linter errors
body: cargo clippy gives warnings for not using Eq in some derives

title: Dev v0.5
body:
This PR:
- Removes the implementations of Clone for storage types which are not useful and may cause data corruption if used incorrectly.
- Changes the implementation of the `add_prefix` methods in the storage package to use length prefixing, which should help avoid namespace collisions
- Changes `Keymap::insert` to take the item by reference rather than by value. This is an API-changing bugfix, and aligns it with the implementation in #51

title: Fixed clippy errors and made minor bugfixes to storage readme
body: There are no api changing commits here (I took them back)

title: Storage sub-package is updated (Cosmwasm v1.0 Fork)
body:
This is the updated version of the storage subpackage. There is a minor improvement to keymaps too which should be pushed to master as well in a seperate. Readme is also adjusted slightly.

Important: This needs to be tested in a smart contract before going to master.

title: Fix reverse boolean check in Item
body: `true` should have been `false`. And `false` should have been `true`.

title: Revamp of the storage sub-package
body:
Overhauls all of the objects inside the storage package. Some of the major changes:
1. No more Readonly vs Mut types. Making it easier to get these storage object supported in cosmwasm v1.0
2. Keymaps added. (Allowing iteration over keys and/or items)
3. The API and usage resembles the storage patterns found in cw-storage-plus

I did not upgrade the incubator package. I think Cashmaps can be removed from the incubator as Keymaps should be a more useful and efficient replacement.

The details of how the new storage works can be found in the updated [readme file](https://github.com/srdtrk/secret-toolkit/blob/master/packages/storage/Readme.md) in the storage package. I've already tested these storage objects in my [secret-factory-template contract](https://github.com/srdtrk/secret-factory-contract).

This revamp is a result of my communication with many devs in the community.

title: Srdtrk master
body: This PR is based on #46 and just adds some extra cleanup.

title: Features Authentication Bugfix
body: Before this fix, pausers could not pause/unpause, while other addresses could!

title: binary tree implementation of max heap data structure in storage
body:
This adds MaxHeapStore to the toolkit incubator. It is modeled on AppendStore and is a binary tree implementation of a max heap. It allows for the insertion and removal of comparable items in O(log(n)) time/# of operations.

The readme and tests have an example for how to use with a custom struct that does not already have PartialOrd defined.

title: Deque store debug print
body:
This is a storage wrapper based on AppendStore called DequeStore.
It guarantees constant-cost appending to and popping from a list of items in storage on both directions (front and back).
Also adds a "remove" feature that receives an index and removes it from the list of items

Added remaining snip20 queries
